alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 3:01PM CST until January 12 at 5:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow with occasional blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations into the evening of 1 to 4 inches. Northeast winds gusting as high as 40 mph today. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected with snow and blowing snow tonight and Saturday morning. Northwest winds gusting as high as 50 mph by tonight. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Illinois and east central, northeast and southeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 PM CST this afternoon. For the Blizzard Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to noon CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible with significant blowing and drifting snow leading to whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, which could lead to some power outages. For later this weekend into early next week, dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as ten minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This evening, much colder air moves in which could result in a flash freeze on roadways.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren
